entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 05 at 11:59AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: Steady rises on area streams and rivers will continue into the weekend. Moderate to heavy rain on Friday through Saturday, will result in additional opportunities for stream and river rises. Temperatures will be cooling by Saturday, which will slow snow melt, resulting in creek levels beginning a decline into next week.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued May 05 at 8:55PM CDT until May 08 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Wisconsin, including the following county, Marinette. * WHEN...Until noon CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 8:49PM CDT until May 07 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan...Wisconsin... Menominee River near McAllister affecting Marinette and Menominee Counties. Menominee River near Florence affecting Florence, Dickinson and Iron Counties.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 05 at 2:54PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High River Flows and Flooding due to Snowmelt... Despite cooler temperatures yesterday and today, rivers and streams are expected to continue running high as warm temperatures have melted much of the valley and foothills snowpack, which is making its way into the main stem rivers. Local emergency management reported widespread low-land flooding

entry.title: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 2:50PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Wyoming, including the following county, Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MDT Wednesday.
